item.title: Towards a Publicly Available Framework to Process Traceroutes with MetaTrace
item.description: Matthieu Gouel, Omar Darwich, Maxime Mouchet, Kevin Vermeulen The objective of this research is to contribute towards the development of an open-source framework for processing large-scale traceroute datasets. By providing such a framework, we aim to benefit the community by saving time in everyday traceroute analysis and enabling the design of new scalable reactive measurements, where prior traceroute measurements are leveraged to make informed decisions for future ones. It is important to clarify that our goal is not to surpass proprietary solutions like BigQuery, which are utilized by CDNs for processing billions of traceroutes.
